summary: The module provides a concise example of the SIGN (Scalable Inception Graph Neural Networks) approach, illustrating how to precompute multi‑hop diffusion of node features on a graph, construct a lightweight neural model that consumes the concatenated diffused features, and run a simple training and evaluation pipeline on the Cora citation network.
business_intent: Showcase an efficient graph neural network workflow that leverages sparse matrix operations for pre‑computed feature diffusion, enabling fast node classification on large graphs.
